name: pathetically
content:
pathetically adverb
(VERY BAD)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is not at all enough or good enough: They get paid a pathetically low salary. My parents' advice on sex was pathetically inadequate.
disapproving in a bad way that causes loss of respect and anger: I can't believe anyone would behave so pathetically as to cheat on that test. They are pathetically, disgracefully incompetent.
More examplesFewer examplesMy efforts look pathetically crude compared to his.The title of the story seemed pathetically unimaginative and dull.Pathetically, he tried to sell her story to a tabloid newspaper.

pathetically adverb
(SADLY)
in a way that causes feelings of sadness and sympathy, especially because a person or animal is suffering: The child was pathetically thin. The dog's hind legs dragged pathetically on the ground.
More examplesFewer examples"He took my money," said the old man pathetically.They dream of having pathetically basic things, like dental care.
